Meet Larry Norman Page, Google's New CEO Google announced Thursday that Google co-founder Larry Norman Page will be replacing Eric Schmidt as CEO. Day-to-day adult supervision no longer needed! Eric Schmidt tweeted of the change. Eric Schmidt has been CEO since 2001, during which time he has overseen the company's growth from a Silicon Valley web goliath grossing over$ 29 billion in 2010. as Google CEO Google just announced a huge change in management. As of April, Eric Schmidt is out as CEO, and co-founder Larry Page will take over his day-to-day duties. Meanwhile, co-founder Sergey Brin will devote his energy to strategic projects, in particular working on new products. Eric Schmidt 's new role will be Executive Chairman. He will focus "externally on deals, partnerships, customers and broader business relationships, government outreach and technology thought leadership," the company announced. Eric Schmidt
